item.title: Highly Anticipated PS5 Exclusive Teased for Gamescom
item.description:
Highlights

  • Death Stranding 2: On The Beach is strongly rumored to be featured at Gamescom 2024.
  • Hideo Kojima recently tweeted a mysterious Death Stranding 2 character poster, and responses from Gamescom host Geoff Keighley further allude to more news imminently.
  • Fans anticipate a new Death Stranding 2 trailer or release date announcement at Gamescom, but Tokyo Game Show may hold bigger surprises.

Numerous recent teases suggest that the upcoming PlayStation 5 exclusive Death Stranding 2: On The Beach will seemingly receive more information at the upcoming Gamescom 2024 live show. The game was last featured at the January 2024 State of Play with an unusually long 9-minute trailer, and fans have been wondering when they'll get to see more of Death Stranding 2 .

First revealed under the codename DS2 at the 2022 Game Awards, Death Stranding 2: On The Beach is the much-awaited sequel to Hideo Kojima's Death Stranding . The 2022 trailer showed the return of Norman Reedus as an older Sam Porter Bridges, as well as glimpses of other characters and the game's general setting. The longer State of Play trailer for Death Stranding 2 , meanwhile, revealed some story details and a 2025 release window. However, its cryptic pacing and surrealistic scenes made it rather difficult for fans to decipher, leading to calls for more information about Death Stranding 2 .

While it's heavily rumored that Hideo Kojima will be present at September's Tokyo Game Show to present a new trailer for Death Stranding 2 , it appears fans can expect more information about the game rather imminently. A recent tweet from Kojima teases a concealed Death Stranding 2 character, who will seemingly be played by Japanese actor Kenjiro Tsuda. The timing of the tweet is very curious, as Gamescom Opening Night Live will air on August 20. Gamescom Opening Night Live host Geoff Keighley has also retweeted the Death Stranding 2 tease, heavily hinting at the game being featured during tomorrow's event.

Kojima Posts Death Stranding 2 Character Poster One Day Before Gamescom 2024

Strengthening the notion further is another recent tweet from Kojima, which showed Elle Fanning's Death Stranding 2 character in what appears to be a cutscene. Keighley responded to this tweet with the double-eyes emoji, yet again teasing Kojima's involvement in Gamescom 2024. Kojima has frequently used Keighley's events to announce his games as well, like the experimental Xbox title OD at the 2023 Game Awards, so the evidence does line up in favor of a new Death Stranding 2 trailer or information dropping imminently at Gamescom.

It'll be interesting to see what Kojima potentially has in store for Death Stranding 2 fans at Gamescom 2024, with speculation ranging from an all-new story trailer to a simple release date announcement and some new details. Tempering expectations would be a safe bet, though, as Death Stranding 2 publisher PlayStation will attend Tokyo Game Show as a general exhibitor after a hiatus of five years, so it may choose to reserve bigger details about the game until then.

item.title: How to Unlock the Water Seal in Fields of Mistria
item.description:
Quick Links

  • How to Get Lantern Moth in Fields of Mistria
  • How to Get Ruby in Fields of Mistria
  • How to Get Stone Loach in Fields of Mistria
  • How to Get Upper Mines Mushroom in Fields of Mistria

Once you make it to the 20th floor of the Mines in Fields of Mistria , there will be a Water Seal that needs to be broken. The tablet will be in an unknown language, so you'll need to take a rubbing of it to Eiland so they can translate the text. You'll get the Water Tablet Rubbing, which will kick off the ' The Water Tablet' quest .

Find Eiland on the map, show him the tablet, and he'll take you to their office. Once the text is translated, you'll finally learn the required items needed to break the water seal: One Lantern Moth , one Ruby , one Stone Loach , and one Upper Mines Mushroom.

How to Get Lantern Moth in Fields of Mistria

Lantern Moth Location

To start, you'll need to catch a Lantern Moth with a bug net, which will be found in the early levels of the Mine, specifically in the Upper Mines. They will appear near lanterns and other sources of light.

How to Get Ruby in Fields of Mistria

Ruby Location

Like Lantern Moths, Rubies can also be found in the Upper Mines and obtained with a pickaxe . Look for rocks with red/ purplish gems , like the one in the picture above.

How to Get Stone Loach in Fields of Mistria

Stone Loach Location

Stone Loach can be found in the Upper Mines of Fields of Mistria. Look for the medium-sized shadows in bodies of water and get your fishing rod ready.

You can sell Stone Loach for 35 Tesserae, but make sure to donate one to the Museum first to complete the Upper Mines fish set.

How to Get Upper Mines Mushroom in Fields of Mistria

Upper Mines Mushroom Location

And last but not least, we have the Upper Mines Mushroom . You can find these lying on the ground in the Mines --you don't even need a tool to pick it up. Just harvest it like you would other Fields of Mistria crops. It kind of looks like a potato. Once you use it for the Water Seal, you can donate or sell your next one.

Bring all the items to the seal to unlock the next area of the Mines, The Tide Caverns. Also, visiting the dragon statue near your farm will give you your second magic spell, Summon Rain . This allows you to bring a rainstorm to your farm briefly. Keep breaking seals in the mines to unlock more stuff (there are five in total).

item.title: Pokemon GO Adding Generation 8 Pokemon That Will Shake Up Battles
item.description:
Highlights

  • Pokemon GO will be adding Morpeko, a unique Pokemon that can switch between two different types mid-battle using a Charged Attack.
  • With the addition of Morpeko, players will be one step closer to completing their Galar region Pokedex in Pokemon GO.
  • Niantic continues to release new content for Pokemon GO.

Niantic has confirmed that an upcoming update to Pokemon GO will be adding Morpeko, who will be able to transform mid-battle by using a Charged Attack. Pokemon GO has enjoyed such incredible longevity thanks to the steady stream of new content that has been released for the augmented reality mobile game over the years. Fans constantly have new Pokemon, quests, and gameplay features to check out, giving them good reason to play each and every single day.

At the time of this writing, it's not possible to catch all Pokemon in Pokemon GO , but Niantic has continued to make strides toward that goal. Batches of new Pokemon are added to Pokemon GO every season, and now Niantic has started to tease new Pokemon that will be added at some point in the near future.

Pokemon GO will be adding Generation 8 Pokemon Morpeko in a future update. Morpeko is a unique Pokemon in that it can switch between two different types. While in Full Belly Mode, Morpeko is an Electric-type, but while in Hagrny Mode, Morpeko is a Dark-type. This unique trait will be featured in Pokemon GO as well, with players able to switch types by using Morpeko's Charged Attack Aura Wheel. This will make Morpeko one of the more unique Pokemon available in Pokemon GO . A specific release date for Morpeko in Pokemon GO hasn't been announced at the time of this writing. Other Pokemon will be able to change forms in Pokemon GO battles as well, but for now the focus is on Morpeko.

Pokemon GO is Adding Morpeko

When Morpeko joins Pokemon GO , it will get fans one step closer to being able to complete their Galar region Pokedex. There are still many Galar region Pokemon that have yet to make their way to Pokemon GO , but perhaps they will join the game alongside Morpeko. Specifics to that effect haven't been announced, but fans of the game should keep an eye out for more info.

Morpeko's Pokemon GO debut was revealed as part of the August 18 Pokemon franchise announcements that took place during the Pokemon World Championships. That same event also saw Niantic tease the debut of Dynamax and Gigantamax forms in Pokemon GO , while The Pokemon Company confirmed Pokemon Trading Card Game Pocket for release on October 30.

Fans can expect plenty more Pokemon GO updates throughout 2024, though details on what all is on the way will have to wait for later. In the more immediate future, Pokemon GO players can look forward to Morpeko joining the game and the debut of Dynamax and Gigantamax forms.

item.title: Sonic X Shadow Generations Reveals Collector's Edition
item.description:
Highlights

  • Limited Run Games and Sega are teaming up to release a special Sonic X Shadow Generations Collector’s Edition.
  • The Collector's Edition comes with tons of bonuses, including a statue of Sonic and Shadow standing on top of a Sega Dreamcast, a soundtrack CD, a commemorative Sega Dreamcast jewel case, and more.
  • Pre-orders for the $249.99 Collector’s Edition start on August 19 and run until October 6, with the game set to release on October 22.

Limited Run Games is partnering with Sega to create a special Collector’s Edition of Sonic X Shadow Generations , complete with an assortment of bonuses crafted for die-hard fans. Sonic X Shadow Generations is set to launch on October 22, bringing the 2010 anniversary title to modern consoles with a new story campaign centered around Shadow as he faces off against enemies and locations from his past.

Over the past few months, the developers behind Sonic X Shadow Generations have been showing off some of the new levels found in Shadow’s campaign, including those drawn from less-fondly remembered installments like Sonic 06 and Shadow the Hedgehog . Sega has also revealed some of the bonuses for those who pre-order Sonic X Shadow Generations , such as an alternate Sonic skin inspired by his bulkier appearance in the original Sonic Adventure and a reversible cover featuring the game’s Japanese box art.

Limited Run Games, the company behind the physical release of Beyond Good and Evil - 20th Anniversary Edition and the upcoming Gex Trilogy current-gen ports, has announced that it is working alongside Sega to release a special edition of Sonic X Shadow Generations . The Collector’s Edition will contain a physical copy of the game in a collector’s box and a special Steelbook case for both the Nintendo Switch cartridge and Blu-ray versions.

Sonic X Shadow Generations Collector’s Edition Bonuses

  • Standard Edition for PC OR Physical Day One Edition of Sonic X Shadow Generations for Nintendo Switch, PS4, PS5, and Xbox Series X
  • Physical Day One Edition Only:
    • Sonic Adventure Skin
    • Gerald Robotnik's Journal
    • Reversible Cover
    • Sonic & Shadow Dreamcast Statue
    • Switch or Blu-ray Steelbook
    • Deluxe Art Book
    • Original Soundtrack CD
    • Chao Mini Figurines
    • Sonic, Shadow, and Classic Sonic Shoes Keychain
    • Commemorative Dreamcast Jewel Case
    • Collector’s Box
    • Individually Numbered Certificate of Authenticity

This special Collector’s Edition of Sonic X Shadow Generations contains plenty of neat bonuses, including the previously mentioned Sonic Adventure character skin and reversible Sonic X Shadow Generations cover. There will also be a physical copy of Professor Gerald Robotnik’s journal, a deluxe Art Book, a statue of Sonic and Shadow standing on top of a Sega Dreamcast, three cute Chao mini-figures, a keychain featuring Sonic and Shadow’s signature sneakers, a soundtrack CD, and a commemorative Sega Dreamcast jewel case.

Pre-orders for the Sonic X Shadow Generations Collector’s Edition are set to start on August 19 and will run until October 6, with the bundle set to retail for $249.99. Sonic X Shadow Generations already promises to be an exciting blast through Sonic’s past and one of the cornerstones of Sega’s Year of Shadow promotion, and the newly announced Collector’s Edition comes with plenty of unique extras for fans of gaming’s most famous pair of hedgehogs.

item.title: Monopoly GO: When Is The Best Time To Open The Gold Vault
item.description:
Quick Links

  • What Is Sticker For Rewards In Monopoly GO
  • When Is The Best Time To Open The Gold Vault

Stickers are collectible items in Monopoly GO that add an extra layer of fun and strategy to the game. These cards are organized into albums, each containing multiple sticker sets that highlight different aspects of the album’s theme. Collecting all the stickers in a set rewards you with dice rolls, cash, and other goodies, while completing an entire album gives you a special grand prize.

You can collect stickers by participating in events and tournaments, completing quick wins, spinning the Color Set wheel, or even purchasing them with real money. With time, you can collect hundreds of extra stickers. Thankfully, all of these duplicate Stickers can be exchanged for rewards in the Stickers for Rewards section.

Related
Monopoly GO: Today’s Event Schedule (August 18)

Discover what’s happening today in Monopoly GO with this comprehensive event schedule guide.

Previously, a Gold Vault used to reward Monopoly GO players with a Wild Sticker, a rare card that allowed you to choose any missing sticker to complete a set. However, Scopely has switched things up and removed the Wild Sticker in its newest update. This guide has now been updated with the new Gold Vault rewards and includes tips on when to open it for maximum benefits.

What Is Sticker For Rewards In Monopoly GO

Stickers for Rewards is an exciting feature in Monopoly GO that turns all duplicate stickers into Stars, which can then be used to open three kinds of vaults. These safes can be opened every 24 hours and contain lots of goodies. To find the Stickers for Rewards in Monopoly GO , players need to click on Albums and then tap on the small safe in the lower right corner of the screen.

On the Stickers for Rewards screen, you can see your total sticker stars balance and three types of vaults, with varying costs and rewards. The more stars you spend, the better rewards you will be able to get.

Vault Type

Cost

Possible Rewards

Orange

250 Stars

  • 200 Dice
  • Pink Sticker Pack containing 3 stickers, with one guaranteed 3-star sticker.

Blue

500 Stars

  • 350 Dice
  • Pink Sticker Pack containing 3 stickers, with one guaranteed 3-star sticker.
  • Blue Sticker Pack containing 4 stickers, with one guaranteed 4-star sticker.

Gold

700 Stars

  • 500 Dice
  • Two Blue Sticker Packs containing 4 stickers, with one guaranteed 4-star sticker.
  • One Purple Sticker Pack containing 6 stickers, with one guaranteed 5-star sticker.

When Is The Best Time To Open The Gold Vault

The Gold Vault is the highest tier of reward in the Monopoly GO ’s Stickers for Rewards section. As such, many players hold on to their stars and keep collecting more stickers so that they can buy the Gold Vault. In this scenario, it’s important to wait for the right time and resist the urge to open the vault straight away.

The best time to open the Gold Vault is when you’ve completed most of your Sticker Album and are down to only five-star stickers in Monopoly GO , both gold and non-gold cards. The Purple sticker pack in the Gold Vault guarantees a five-star sticker, which could help you complete your remaining sets faster.

Besides that, it’s worth waiting for the Sticker Boom event before opening the Gold Vault, since this flash event increases the number of stickers players can get when they open a sticker pack.

If you don't use up your sticker stars before the current sticker album ends, you'll automatically receive a vault corresponding to the number of stars you have when the new album begins.
